oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Joseph N. B. Lusk to Adaline Davis
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Joe's love letter to Addie says he is lonely without her. He has been to a singing where he saw many pretty girls, but none as pretty as she. Joe says that he loves Addie and quotes from the 1840s ballad, "I'd Offer Thee This Hand of Mine." He adds a; postscript, "When you have read this please commit it to the flames." Joseph Napoleon Bonaparte Lusk was a lieutenant in the 1st Tenn. Cav. Regt., USA, after deserting the Confederate Army. Joe and Addie married after the war. They lived in Bradley Co.
